summary: An email from an Assistant United States Attorney in the Southern District of New York requesting verification of flight and immigration records for Jeffrey Epstein, specifically concerning potential travel to London during a specific timeframe (March 1994 to March 1995) when an individual was 17 years old.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the email inquiry regarding his flight logs and immigration records, specifically for potential travel to London.

events.title: Timeframe of interest for Epstein's travel
events.description: The period for which the prosecutor is requesting verification of Jeffrey Epstein's flight and immigration records to/from London.

keyFacts: A prosecutor is actively investigating Jeffrey Epstein's travel history, specifically flights to London.
The inquiry focuses on a precise one-year period: March 1994 to March 1995.
The context implies an interest in travel that coincided with a female individual being 17 years old.
The request seeks both private flight logs and official immigration records for cross-verification.
The correspondence originates from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York in early 2020.
